name: places/ChIJvRHhe_xYwokRKFVjsBdrXV0
formattedAddress: 477 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 477 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
Just received a letter in the mail from a collection agency. I had a business back in 2012-2014 which Jeff was my CPA for. According to the IRS, my 1120 was filed 5 months late under his watch - no extension was ever applied for. I now owe $3000 in interest and penalty fees for a business that has been closed for 6 years.

When I contacted him he told me his 2013 files aren’t accessible and he doesn’t know when or if he’ll be able to access them. He also told me because I am no longer a client of his that I’m basically on my own regarding this matter - despite the fact that this matter exists solely because of his late 1120 filing for my business. He was paid to do a job that he didn’t do and now I’m left to figure it all out on my own.

I’m disgusted with his handling of this and I think all of his clients should know how he goes about handling situations. Totally unprofessional!
